reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good face and eyebrow razors
reviews.reviewText: This is a good set of 60 eyebrow and facial razors and shapers that you can use to trim your beard or shape your eyebrows.The blades are sharp and easy to hold and a set of 60 would last probably six months or longer in my home.Good set at a good price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I would buy these at my grocery store for double the price for three. I will definitely re-purchase when needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good considering the price
reviews.reviewText: I use these type of razors for my eyebrows and face and they are good considering the price and how many you receive. I used others that work way better but are more in price so if you’re looking for some that do the job then these are for you but they aren’t 10/10 sharpness. They get the job done

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The amount you get for this price is amazing. I use these for microblading and for cleaning up my eyebrows. They’re so easy to use and I just throw it away after. Easy for traveling and storing

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing for a first-timer!
reviews.reviewText: Over 50 and derma planing at home for first time. A friend recommended these and after watching many youtube videos on "How to", I gave these a try yesterday.. It has been over a year since I had an aesthetician derma plane my face, so I was a little skeptical and scared, but oh how gratifying! My face and neck feel SO much better! Not to mention, I don't see all of the peach fuzz in the sunlight! Exceptional value for the money. Don't wait like I did, give them a try!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So many for so little!
reviews.reviewText: my family loves these. They come in a huge pack at a great price. If you use these, this is the perfect pack! It seems silly to buy a three pack for almost the same price. I keep them everywhere. I even use them for other things, since the blades work great. Opening packages and mail lol. The quality does not lack. I highly recommend these!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Blade not even and sharp like higher priced items
reviews.reviewText: Having bought just about every brand of these type razors (dermaplaning works!) - I decided to try the cheap "eyebrow razors" based on price and reviews. I use these mainly like a razor on my face, not just for eyebrows, as the name of this product implies.The blade of this product is not good as Tinkles. The reviews that show poor quality for these are spot on. That said, as you can see from the pictures, the product has its merits (obviously not a professional photographer here!). The cost of these products shown in the picture goes up from left (the current product review) to the most expensive of the three (Japonesque) - based on what I paid for them. If you are a first timer for derma planing - maybe try a high quality product first before going cheap? - that is my opinion.Reviews really help me decide on products and that is why I am taking time to write this review: to possibly help others who may be on the fence about these cheap razors.My opinion is Japonesque is the best quality and they can be purchased on Amazon. I find Tinkles, also on Amazon at fair prices, to be of good enough quality, lower price, and, like Japonesque, they can be used a few times. This is a once a week hygiene practice for me so it is really worth it to go with higher quality. That said, I provide some potential pros for these cheap razors below.The pictures show the used products of all 3, new product packaging for Tinkles, and the "bulk cheaper razors" . The cheapest one could not be used more than once as the blade deflected after one use - this is not visible in the photo. It caused scratches on my face. As the product description on Amazon states clearly - do not press hard on your face! However, I need to press just hard enough to exfoliate and trim "peach fuzz" on my face.Some reviews complain these cheap razors arrived with finger prints on them, and I did not find that to be the case - just cheaper plastic scratches from the razors scraping against each other - likely because they come in bulk packaging. IMHO these cheap blades could be used for crafting projects - especially since they have that protective cover - How can the company make a profit selling these at 17cents per blade?! It really is inexpensive, if you can use them.Another plug for the cheapest razors: If you believe the dermabrasion caused by these blades might stimulate collagen (versus scarring) and do not mind the nicks that come from the poor blade quality, then these blades might be a deal for you.I am on the fence about returning them, based on price alone - otherwise, for dermaplaning, I will go back to using Tinkle based on the quality/price ratio and "splurge" on Japonesque when there is a sale (they feel great in my hand and are just the right weight and size). Both products really work well for me - what can I say? - I am a bargain hunter at heart.Hope this was helpful:).
